titleInfo.title: McKinley High School Oral History Project: History of the School
titleInfo.subTitle: Freddie Smith Jr. oral history interview, 1995

name.description: Freddie Smith Jr. was born in New Orleans, La., in 1945 to Freddie and Estelle Smith. He attended McKinley High School from 1959 through 1963 and went on to Grambling College (now Grambling State University), where he received a degree in Recreation. After college, he worked at the Exxon Refinery in Baton Rouge for fifteen years, and then worked as a lab technician at Ciba-Geigy in St. Gabriel. He is married to Patricia Haynes Smith and they have six children.

mods.abstract: In this brief interview, Smith recalls his experiences as a student at McKinley from 1959 to 1963. He describes a typical day's schedule, his participation in sports, the emphasis on academics, and his academic achievements. He talks about his favorite teacher, Mildred Cummings, recalls community involvement at McKinley, names some prominent graduates, and discusses McKinley's influence on Baton Rouge.
